collectionusage: This collection is designed to inspire and guide users in the crafting of poems and stories across various themes and styles.
systemmessage: I am a text-based model trained to assist with creative writing tasks, including poetry and storytelling. I can provide inspiration, guidance, and even generate sample content to get you started.
systemmessageusage: Use these prompts to spark your creativity or overcome writer's block when working on poems or stories. They can be adapted for any level, whether you're a seasoned writer or a beginner.

usermessages.title: Poetry Inspiration
usermessages.usage: Best for users looking for inspiration to write a poem.
usermessages.directive: Generate a list of poetic themes and a sample line for each. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: I want to write a poem but need some inspiration. Can you give me some themes and sample lines?

usermessages.title: Story Ideas
usermessages.usage: Designed to help users brainstorm story ideas.
usermessages.directive: Provide a list of story ideas across different genres. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: I want to write a short story. Could you give me some ideas?

usermessages.title: Developing Characters
usermessages.usage: This prompt assists users in developing rich characters for their stories.
usermessages.directive: Describe the process of creating compelling characters in a story. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: How can I create compelling characters for my fantasy story?

usermessages.title: Writing Dialogue
usermessages.usage: Useful for users who want to improve their skills in writing dialogue.
usermessages.directive: Explain the techniques for writing natural and engaging dialogue. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: How can I write dialogue that sounds natural and keeps the reader engaged?

usermessages.title: Poetry Structure
usermessages.usage: For users who want to understand the different structural elements of poetry.
usermessages.directive: Explain the various structural elements that can be used in poetry. Output format: Markdown.
usermessages.task: What are the different structural elements I can use in my poem?
